Ingredients: lean ground beef;onion;soy sauce;garlic;rotelle pasta;milk;butter;processed American cheese
Step 1: In a large skillet over medium heat, cook beef, onion, soy sauce and garlic until beef is brown and juices run clear.
Step 2: While beef is cooking, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Step 3: Return cooked pasta to its pot over low heat; stir in milk and butter. Stir in beef mixture until well combined. Stir in cheese slices, one at a time, until melted. Serve at once.

Ingredients: ground beef;envelope taco seasoning mix;shredded Cheddar cheese;ranch dressing;Italian-style salad dressing;red onion;head lettuce shredded;nacho-flavor tortilla chips crushed into bite-size pieces
Step 1: Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat, breaking the meat up as it cooks, until beef is browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease and stir in taco seasoning mix. Remove from heat and let stand until beef mixture is cool.
Step 2: Mix ground beef with Cheddar cheese, ranch dressing, Italian dressing, and red onion in a large salad bowl. Chill the beef mixture until cold, at least 30 minutes. Lightly mix in lettuce and tortilla chips just before serving.

Ingredients: light brown sugar;soy sauce;pineapple juice (optional);water;vegetable oil;large garlic cloves;boneless round steak cut into 1/4-inch slices;bamboo skewers soaked in water
Step 1: Whisk brown sugar, soy sauce, pineapple juice, water, vegetable oil, and garlic together in a large bowl; drop beef slices into the mixture and stir to coat. Cover bowl with plastic wrap.
Step 2: Marinate beef in refrigerator for 24 hours.
Step 3: Remove beef from the marinade, shaking to remove any excess liquid. Discard marinade.
Step 4: Thread beef slices in a zig-zag onto the skewers.
Step 5: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
Step 6: Cook skewers on preheated grill until the beef is cooked through, about 3 minutes per side.

Ingredients: fish sauce;fresh red chile peppers;garlic;beef sirloin;peanut oil;chopped asparagus;beef stock;basil leaves
Step 1: Make a marinade by combining the fish sauce, chile peppers, and garlic in a shallow dish.
Step 2: Lay beef into the marinade, turning to coat.
Step 3: Marinate beef in refrigerator 8 hours to overnight.
Step 4: Remove the beef from the marinade and shake off excess liquid. Discard the remaining marinade.
Step 5: Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in hot oil until hot but slightly pink in the center, 3 to 5 minutes; remove from oil with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towel.
Step 6: Heat remaining tablespoon peanut oil in the skillet; cook and stir asparagus in hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes.
Step 7: Pour beef stock into the pan and bring to a simmer.
Step 8: Return the beef to the pan. Add the basil and continue cooking until hot, about 1 minute more.

Ingredients: lean ground beef;potato;vinegar;garlic;thyme leaves;salt and ground black pepper to taste
Step 1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until some of the fat renders, 1 to 2 minutes; add potatoes, vinegar, garlic, and thyme. Continue to cook the beef mixture, stirring frequently, until the beef is completely browned and crumbly and the potato is soft, 12 to 15 minutes more.

Ingredients: ground beef;butter;zucchini sliced 1/2-inch thick;dried minced onion;water;Knorr¬Æ Rice Sides‚Ñ¢;tomatoes diced;Worcestershire sauce;grated Cheddar cheese;Salt and black pepper to taste
Step 1: Brown ground beef in skillet over medium to medium-high heat, stirring to crumble. Transfer browned beef to a bowl.
Step 2: Melt butter the same skillet; add zucchini and saute until just slightly softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Return ground beef to skillet along with dried onions, water, Knorr® Rice SidesTM- Beef, chopped tomatoes, and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low; cover and cook for 7 minutes. Top with cheese. Let sit 5 minutes before serving.
